intro: Achyranthes stellata, commonly known as the starleaf knotweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences, typically appearing in shades of pink or red. Achyranthes stellata is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
